normalised: manufacturing and supply chain quality control upgrade for make in India

unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Quality Control Upgrade for ‘Make in India’**
normalised: experts at I I T Delhi conducted a workshop on october twenty sixth two thousand and twenty three, highlighting the critical role of robust quality control in strengthening India’s manufacturing prowess. the session, attended by representatives from various industries including textile units from Surat and auto component manufacturers from Chennai, focused on minimizing defects and improving overall efficiency.

unnormalised: Experts at IIT-Delhi conducted a workshop on October 26, 2023, highlighting the critical role of robust quality control in strengthening India’s manufacturing prowess. The session, attended by representatives from various industries including textile units from Surat and auto component manufacturers from Chennai, focused on minimizing defects and improving overall efficiency.
normalised: doctor Meena Sharma, a renowned quality control consultant, emphasized the importance of integrating statistical process control S P C techniques and rigorous testing at every stage of the supply chain, from sourcing raw materials to the final dispatch. reducing defective products not only saves costs – potentially lakhs of rupees annually for some units – but also enhances brand reputation, she stated. she referenced the upcoming Diwali festival, stressing that quality is paramount as consumer demand peaks.

unnormalised: Dr. Meena Sharma, a renowned quality control consultant, emphasized the importance of integrating statistical process control (SPC) techniques and rigorous testing at every stage of the supply chain, from sourcing raw materials to the final dispatch. "Reducing defective products not only saves costs – potentially lakhs of Rupees annually for some units – but also enhances brand reputation," she stated. She referenced the upcoming Diwali festival, stressing that quality is paramount as consumer demand peaks.
normalised: a key takeaway was the need for skilled personnel. plans for training programs are underway, slated to begin at two post meridian on november fifteenth, two thousand and twenty three, offering certifications aligning with international standards. participants also discussed implementing stricter vendor audits from january first, two thousand and twenty four to ensure consistent quality throughout the entire supply network.

unnormalised: A key takeaway was the need for skilled personnel. Plans for training programs are underway, slated to begin at 14:00 hrs on November 15th, 2023, offering certifications aligning with international standards. Participants also discussed implementing stricter vendor audits from January 1, 2024 to ensure consistent quality throughout the entire supply network.
